Package alluxio.worker

Worker process and utils for working with the worker remotely.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AlluxioWorkerService
    A worker in the Alluxio system.
    DataServer
    Defines how to interact with a server running the data protocol.
    Worker
    Interface of an Alluxio worker.
    WorkerFactory
    Interface for factory of Worker.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractWorker
    This is the base class for all workers, and contains common functionality.
    AlluxioWorker
    Class for running an Alluxio worker.
    AlluxioWorkerRestServiceHandler
    This class is a REST handler for requesting general worker information.
    DataServer.Factory
    Factory for DataServer.
    DefaultAlluxioWorker
    Entry point for the Alluxio worker program.
    SessionCleaner
    SessionCleaner periodically checks if any session have become zombies, removes the zombie session and associated data when necessary.
    SessionCleanupCallback
    Interface for classes which track sessions and provide a method to clean any expired sessions.

Package alluxio.worker Description

Worker process and utils for working with the worker remotely. Main entry point for the worker is AlluxioWorker.main(String[]) which gets started by the alluxio start scripts. The AlluxioWorkerService spins up the different RPC services (thrift, data) which are mostly wrappers around BlockWorker.

Services

Thrift

The thrift service is mostly responsible for metadata operations (with a few operations that effect the worker's cached memory).

Cache Block

Move's user generated blocks to the alluxio data directory. This operation expects that the caller is a local (to the node) caller, and that the input are under the user directories. Implementation can be found at BlockWorker.commitBlock(long, long)

Lock / Unlock

Alluxio supports caching blocks to local disk (client side). When this happens, a lock is given to the client to protect it from the remote block changing. Implementation can be found at BlockWorker.lockBlock(long, long) and BlockWorker.unlockBlock(long, long).

Data

This service is the main interaction between users and reading blocks. Currently this service only supports reading blocks (writing is to local disk). There are two different implementations of this layer: NettyDataServer and nio.NIODataServer; netty is the default. To support both, a DataServer interface is used that just defines how to start/stop, and get port details; to start, object init is used. The current read protocol is defined in DataServerMessage. This has two different types: read DataServerMessage.createBlockRequestMessage() and write DataServerMessage.createBlockResponseMessage(boolean, long, java.nio.ByteBuffer). Side note, the netty implementation does not use this class, but has defined two classes for the read and write case: RPCBlockReadRequest, RPCBlockReadResponse; theses classes are network compatible.
